      • withContext

        public static org.openrdf.model.Model withContext(Iterable<org.openrdf.model.Statement> theGraph,
                                                  org.openrdf.model.Resource theResource)
        Returns a copy of the provided graph where all the statements belong to the specified context. This will overwrite any existing contexts on the statements in the graph.
        Parameters:
        theGraph - the graph
        theResource - the context for all the statements in the graph
        Returns:
        the new graph

      • union

        public static org.openrdf.model.Model union(org.openrdf.model.Model... theGraphs)
        Return a new Graph which is the union of all the provided graphs.
        Parameters:
        theGraphs - the graphs to union
        Returns:
        the union of the graphs

      • getObject

        public static Optional<org.openrdf.model.Value> getObject(org.openrdf.model.Model theGraph,
                                                          org.openrdf.model.Resource theSubj,
                                                          org.openrdf.model.IRI thePred)
        Return the value of the property for the given subject. If there are multiple values, only the first value will be returned.
        Parameters:
        theGraph - the graph
        theSubj - the subject
        thePred - the property of the subject whose value should be retrieved
        Returns:
        optionally, the value of the the property for the subject

      • getLiteral

        public static Optional<org.openrdf.model.Literal> getLiteral(org.openrdf.model.Model theGraph,
                                                             org.openrdf.model.Resource theSubj,
                                                             org.openrdf.model.IRI thePred)
        Return the value of of the property as a Literal
        Parameters:
        theGraph - the graph
        theSubj - the resource
        thePred - the property whose value is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        Optionally, the property value as a literal. Value will be absent of the SP does not have an O, or the O is not a literal

      • getResource

        public static Optional<org.openrdf.model.Resource> getResource(org.openrdf.model.Model theGraph,
                                                               org.openrdf.model.Resource theSubj,
                                                               org.openrdf.model.IRI thePred)
        Return the value of of the property as a Resource
        Parameters:
        theGraph - the graph
        theSubj - the resource
        thePred - the property whose value is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        Optionally, the property value as a Resource. Value will be absent of the SP does not have an O, or the O is not a Resource*

      • getBooleanValue

        public static Optional<Boolean> getBooleanValue(org.openrdf.model.Model theGraph,
                                                org.openrdf.model.Resource theSubj,
                                                org.openrdf.model.IRI thePred)
        Returns the value of the property on the given resource as a boolean.
        Parameters:
        theGraph - the graph
        theSubj - the resource
        thePred - the property
        Returns:
        Optionally, the value of the property as a boolean. Value will be absent if the SP does not have an O, or that O is not a literal or not a valid boolean value

      • isList

        public static boolean isList(org.openrdf.model.Model theGraph,
                             org.openrdf.model.Resource theRes)
        Returns whether or not the given resource is a rdf:List
        Parameters:
        theGraph - the graph
        theRes - the resource to check
        Returns:
        true if its a list, false otherwise

      • asList

        Return the contents of the given list by following the rdf:first/rdf:rest structure of the list
        Parameters:
        theGraph - the graph
        theRes - the resource which is the head of the list
        Returns:
        the contents of the list.

        Parameters:
        theResources - the list
        Returns:
        the list as RDF

        Parameters:

        theRes - the resource
        Returns:
        the asserted rdf:type's of the resource
